Thanks "diogogb".

This is Portuguese-Brazil version, original from TechNET, see the Hash after downloading and extracting.

See ya.

Hi "kgee2012"!

Thank you for comment.

I will try explain,

Hash: Hash functions are mostly used to accelerate table lookup or data comparison tasks such as finding items in a database, detecting duplicated or similar records in a large file, finding similar stretches in DNA sequences, and so on.

SHA-1: SHA-1 is a algorithm for cryptographic hash function.

With number SHA-1 we can compare the sequence of binary code from 2 files to make sure it is legitimate and has not been modified.

TechNET give us the SHA-1 code, to confirm get in: 
http://technet.microsoft.com/subscriptions/downloads/hh442904#searchTerm=Windows%207%20Professional&ProductFamilyId=0&Languages=pt&Architectures=x64&PageSize=50&PageIndex=0&FileId=0


References: Wikipedia, TechNET.

See ya.
